Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Hi, I'd like to look at the code that is behind a simple RPC but don't know where to find it.  Could someone please point me in the right direction?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @CrisF issuing a RPC request or creating something that responds to such requests?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: I'd like to compare the code for something like `help` to compare that with what an API looks like.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Basically I'd like to see the code that is run when I do `komodo-cli help` but don't know where to find it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: help call in turn calls all the available rpc calls with the helpflag set, each rpc call then sees that help flag and prints out the help for that comman

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Maybe that isn't a good example.  I'm wondering how much code there is behind it.  Or `getinfo`. 
I'd like to see how much programming is behind that and try and read it.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: rcp code is in a bunch of different files, but here's an example - https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/blob/master/src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp#L161

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just look at the code in the rpc folder

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Cool, thanks a lot!  I wasn't sure where to find it ü§¶

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
```  CXXLD    komodod
libcc.so: In function `custom_rawtxresult(UniValue&, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, int)':
cclib.cpp:(.text+0x4b3b): undefined reference to `base_blob<256u>::ToString() const'```
makes compiling KMD tad hard on 18.04 LTS... is this issue known ?
I think it can be reproduced with 18.04 and installing git and build-essentials and autoconf and then compiling depends then do this command
``` ./configure --prefix=`pwd`/depends/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/ --disable-tests --disable-bench --disable-proton --disable-zmq```
